pages.title: Lens Frame
pages.text: The <item>Lens Frame/$ is a utility device for manipulating <thing>$(l:intro/beam)beams/$, and has many uses. Beams can travel through it along the axis with the giant hole, and the <item>lens frame/$ <em>will not delay the beam at all/$, even if it is performing an effect.$(br2)

Several different items can be used as a 'lens' by right-clicking it into the <item>frame/$. Only one lens per <item>frame/$ at a time (but multiple <item>frames/$ can be used in a row).$(br2)Using a $(l:intro/ores)ruby/$ will delete anything from the beam that isn't <thing>energy/$.$(br2)Using an emerald will delete anything from the beam that isn't

<thing>potential/$.$(br2)Using a diamond will delete anything from the beam that isn't <thing>stability/$.$(br2)Using a $(l:intro/ores)void crystal/$ will convert the entire beam to <thing>$(l:beam/void)void/$.$(br2)Using $(l:fluid/ingr)pure quartz/$ with a <thing>light alignment/$ beam will convert the $(l:fluid/ingr)pure quartz/$ to bright quartz. This is a cheap
way to make bright quartz, as it doesn't consume the beam.$(br2)
<thing>$(l:essentials/circuits)Circuits/$ will read the <thing>power/$ of the beam currently going through the <item>lens frame/$.$(br2)
